Posts.Content: Yes, zero is possible. It may take a while, and you may get the two year bounce. I had 116 seeds implanted in 2003. I have been in the zero club for about 10 years now!
Posts.Title: Seed implant question about post PSA results

Posts.Content: I went from 4.5 to < 1.0 after Brachy. A year later I was at < 0.6. Two years it bounced to 0.9. Then settled down to 0.0 and that's where it has remained. I had 116 I-125 seeds on July 25, 2003. It often takes time to settle down.
Posts.Title: Forum users PSA results post Bracchy?

Posts.Content: I went from 4.5 to < 1.0 after Brachy. A year later I was at < 0.6. Two years it bounced to 0.9. Then settled down to 0.0 and that's where it has remained. I had 116 I-125 seeds on July 25, 2003. It often takes time to settle down.
Posts.Title: Forum users PSA results post Bracchy?

Posts.Content: Yes, zero is possible. It may take a while, and you may get the two year bounce. I had 116 seeds implanted in 2003. I have been in the zero club for about 10 years now!
Posts.Title: Seed implant question about post PSA results

Posts.Content: WOW. I'm 15 years cancer free and I had Brachy. 116 I-125 seeds. I made the decision to have it when we talked to the rad. onc. for 3 hours. I felt comfortable in his care. Never looked back!
Posts.Title: Ten Year Treatment Outcomes of RP vs. EBRT vs. BT

Posts.Content: I have taken both, but now only take flomax. I have taken it for over 10 years. I took saw palmetto before PC for BPH, then the doc told me to lay off the saw palmetto because it could affect the PSA numbers.
Posts.Title: Flomax vs. Saw Palmetto

Posts.Content: Welcome, If I were you, I probably would have started in April, when the mets were found.
Posts.Title: Should I start chemo?

Posts.Content: Welcome, If I were you, I probably would have started in April, when the mets were found.
Posts.Title: Should I start chemo?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by cvictim Most of the side effects have subsided. Still get the bowel urgency , not as bad though. My Oncologist stated that Colo-rectal Cancer is possible after Rad Treatments. I just have to keep an eye on things as my stool color has changed and or not consistent as before the treatments, Good to hear that most have subsided. I can remember not passing a restroom after my treatment. I had many close calls.
Posts.Title: Radiation side-effects

Posts.Content: Tom, Glad to hear you are doing well. Your PSA should continue to drop till it gets to 0.0 Mine did and it still is holding there after 12 years. I had 116 I-125 seeds done in Plano. Texas. I'm glad I chose what I chose. Just goes to show you that you have to make a best guess what will be good for you and don't look back. Lee
Posts.Title: BRACHY REPORT...6 Months Out

Posts.Content: Hello Tom, I had Brachy when I was 53. I had a very successful out come. I'll be 64 very soon and my PSA is still 0. My advice to anyone is do your research, make a decision and don't look back. Only you and your medical team can make an informed decision. I only lost two days of work when I had my seeds implanted. I had a really GREAT Rad. Onc. I hope for all of the best outcome. Lee

Posts.Title: Brachy or Open Surgery? My Dilemma

Posts.Content: Had Brachytherapy 7/03 After a bounce, Psa went to <0.01 I was perusing the net and found this forum. I enjoyed reading several posts and after being 11 years cancer free, I hope I can answer some questions or at least be a "brother from the lodge".
Posts.Title: Not new, but new here.

Posts.Content: The first few years are always the ones that give the most anxiety. Keep positive and look forward to having your 10th year or so. Hey you are from Tyler.... I'm just north of y'all.
Posts.Title: 8 month PSA

Posts.Content: Jeb, I'm straight up 14 (Tyler State Park Road) just past Hawkins. I live in Holly Lake Ranch.
Posts.Title: 8 month PSA

Posts.Content: That is Great News....Welcome to Club Zero!

Posts.Content: That is Great News....Welcome to Club Zero!

Posts.Title: My PSA is 'undetectable' :)

Posts.Content: Yeah, the hard part is over. Now only look forward, don't even think about second guessing yourself. Don't look back. I had Brachy in 2003 and I'm still in the zero club. It was the right decision for me.
Posts.Title: choosing radiation

Posts.Content: I have heard that Costco is very reasonable for drugs. You just tell them at the doors that you are using the pharmacy, and they let you in. I have not tested this yet, as the nearest one is 100 miles from me.
Posts.Title: Throwaway Account, Flomax Question

Posts.Content: Yeah, the hard part is over. Now only look forward, don't even think about second guessing yourself. Don't look back. I had Brachy in 2003 and I'm still in the zero club. It was the right decision for me.
Posts.Title: choosing radiation

Posts.Content: That's GREAT! news. Anything that low probably has a rounding factor. Keep the good news coming.
Posts.Title: Second PSA test of the year for dad tomorrow at 10AM CDT

Posts.Content: I am certainly no HT expert. I only had six months of Casadex and Lupron before my Brachy. It seems to me you are doing something right with the low readings. Are they all from the same lab? Different labs can have very different results. Just a thought. Keep up the good work and keep them as low as possible. My oncologist told me (11 years ago) that I should not even worry unless I broke the 1.0 level.
Posts.Title: Not sure I know where I am going

Posts.Content: Yahhhhoooooooo!! Great news.
Posts.Title: That sweet 0.1

Posts.Content: Jphil, In 2003 I had Brachy . I was a Gleason 3+3 = 6 also and 53 years old. Had 116 I-125 seeds. Prior to that, I had Lupron shots and Casodex to give me the 1-2 punch. The Uro said it would also reduce the size of my prostate. It was a win-win for me as here I am almost 12 years later and still a member of club zero!
Posts.Title: LDR Brachytherapy with Hormone Shot

Posts.Content: Does he use Flomax or any other meds?
Posts.Title: Prostate problems

Posts.Content: Jphil, No, I'm pretty good. I have noticed a little stress incontinence , but I'll attribute that to old age and heavy lifting.
Posts.Title: LDR Brachytherapy with Hormone Shot

Posts.Content: Definitely! Never give up hope! I was diagnosed @ 53 and thought my life was over. I had a good Urologist that sent me to a Great Radiation Oncologist. I kept the faith and here I am 11 years later ... and still cancer free! Mine of course was caught early with a Gleason 7 (3+4) and no bone mets.
Posts.Title: How bad is this?

Posts.Content: AMEN ! To that.
Posts.Title: Happy National Cancer Survivor's Day!

Posts.Content: I always got mine from the urologist's office.
Posts.Title: Who gives the horomone shot

Posts.Content: I always got mine from the urologist's office.
Posts.Title: Who gives the horomone shot

Posts.Content: Your situation is similar to mine 12 years ago. I was 53 and had the choice of surgery or Brachy. Urologist said I would probably leak the rest of my life with surgery and recommended a radiation onc. One visit to him and three hours of talking about what he could do, my wife and I were sold. He was the one! He put me on Lupron shots and cassadex, before the seed implant. It shrank my prostate to a manageable size. I have been a member of the zero club since I had the bounce. 12 years and counting. I'm very happy with my decision for the 116 I-125 seed implant.
Posts.Title: torn between two treatments

Posts.Content: While I didn't have HDR, after my Brachy, I was able to ejaculate. Even though it was a bit bloody, it was a glorious sight. I was 53, so I know what your feeling.

Posts.Title: torn between two treatments

Posts.Content: Bulldog, In July, it will be 15 years since I was implanted with 116 I-125 seeds. I only missed 2 days of work. I probably should have stayed home a bit more due to bathroom problems, but I felt like it was necessary to get moving and stay moving. I also had the 6 months of cassadex and Luepron prior to Brachy. All I can say is it worked, I'm still in the zero club. My RO was a genius and sat with the wife and I for 3 hours on the first visit. He answered all of our questions and really put us at ease.
Posts.Title: Ldr....vs...hdr...brachytherapy
